TULSA, Okla. - Oral Roberts, the evangelist who rose from humble tent revivals to found a multimillion-dollar ministry and a university bearing his name, died Tuesday. He was 91.
 
 Roberts died of complications from pneumonia in Newport Beach, Calif., according to his spokesman, A. Larry Ross. The evangelist was hospitalized after a fall on Saturday. He had survived two heart attacks in the 1990s and a broken hip in 2006.

It so happens that I am deaf. I was not born deaf, but lost my hearing from side-effects of streptomycin. I was just entering the first grade when my hearing gradually began fading until I was about 90% deaf by the third grade. Determination, a competitive spirit, and a faith in Jesus Christ, whom I gave my life to when I was twelve, saw me through a regular school and through college. 
 
 My mom took me to an Oral Roberts crusade when I was in the fourth grade. 
 
 I went with the faith of a child, having heard and seen how Oral Roberts, through Christ, or as he claimed, made the lame walk, the blind see, and the deaf to hear.
 
 We went to the Roberts Crusade for the entire week, each night, Roberts would call A, B, C for people whose last names began with those letters. Mom went and asked when they would call the R's so we could go up to the podium and Roberts could lay ahold of me with those 'healing hands' and restore my hearing. 
 
 On the last day of the crusade, an assistant told all in the audience who needed 'healing' to line up along the walls of the auditorium and Roberts walked along the line laid ahold of each on the head and muttered some words, I don't recall what. I couldn't hear him anyway as I refused to wear my hearing aid, believing he would heal me.
 
 Afterwards, when I returned to school, sans hearing aid, and people asked if he had healed me and I told them that he had. This went on for about a week, until I finally accepted the reality that notwithstanding my believing that he had, nothing had changed. My mom and dad had not had the heart to tell me differently, knowing that it would hit me sooner or later. 
 
 Having had such a powerful negative experience at that young an age, I could have disavowed everything concerning faith, but that did not happen, and I have little patience of those who claim such events destroyed their faith for life, as that is hogwash. No one can destroy your faith unless You allow them to do so and one cannot lose something they never had in the first place. Still, however, I view Oral Roberts and his ilk as only slightly above bottom dwelling unscrupulous lawyers and lying used car salesmen.
 
 Certainly I forgave Roberts a long, long, time ago. He was a charlatan pure and simple, and I believe my greatest issue with him was not me, but the fact of my mom's and dad's hope as they felt so guilty all their life for the streptomycin even though it was the doctor who administered it. 
 
 It has been no great loss. If I don't want to listen to someone, I simply turn off my hearing aid and let them ramble on to their hearts content while I stare at them with that 'dazed' and 'attentive' look. 
 
 I would much rather be deaf than be blind.

 Oh, appreciate that, but it wasn't depravity (unless you consider Roberts). It was simply my mom and dad did not know any better and followed the recommendation of the doctor. I am a country boy and we lived in the country and had a kennel with a passel of good pointing dogs. 
 
 I got into the habit of opening the gate and getting into the dog pen and just passing the time of day with the guys, but the result was I got flea's...bad. Doctor though it was hives. Allergic reaction. Gave me streptomycin over several months as a guinea pig as that drug had just came out back in 1956. 
 
 Mom went back later to try to get the hospital records but back then all they kept were paper records and they claimed they had been (conveniently) destroyed.
